briefTitle: Correlation and Comparison of the HepQuant® Disease Severity Index (DSI) With Hepatic Venous Pressure Gradient (HVPG)

armGroups.label: (HVPG) and HepQuant-SHUNT (HQ-Shunt)
interventionNames: Drug: HepQuant-SHUNT (Drug and Device) #65,123 (4D-cholate) and IND #65,121 (13C-cholate)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Liver disease patient scheduled to have an Hepatic Venous Pressure Gradient (HVPG) procedure
* At time of enrollment, being between the ages of 18 and 75

Exclusion Criteria:

* Concomitant treatment with both a beta blocker and an ACE inhibitor
* Concurrent hepatic malignancy. Patients with a history of treated HCC can be included if there is no evidence of recurrent disease at the time of this study.
* Unstable angina or history of myocardial infarction or congestive heart failure within 6 months prior to enrollment into this study
* Renal insufficiency with chronic kidney disease stage 4 or 5 (GFR \< 30 mL/min/1.73m2)
* Crohn's disease or any active intestinal inflammatory condition
* Having had an ileal resection
* Diabetic Gastroparesis
* Pregnancy or intent to become pregnant. Urine pregnancy tests will be performed prior to HQ SHUNT testing.
* Inability to consent for one's self

outcomeMeasures.title: Results of HepQuant SHUNT Test: Elimination Rate (IV Phase 1 Only; Min-1)
outcomeMeasures.description: Compare Disease Severity Index (DSI) from HQ-SHUNT for defining patients with (HVPG ≥6 mmHg) and without (HVPG \<6 mmHg) portal hypertension.

outcomeMeasures.title: Results of HepQuant SHUNT Test: Systemic Clearance
outcomeMeasures.description: Compare Disease Severity Index (DSI) from HQ-SHUNT for defining patients with (HVPG ≥6 mmHg) and without (HVPG \<6 mmHg) portal hypertension. Systemic Clearance (13C-CA; ml min-1)

outcomeMeasures.title: Results of HepQuant SHUNT Test: Apparent Portal Clearance
outcomeMeasures.description: Compare Disease Severity Index (DSI) from HQ-SHUNT for defining patients with (HVPG ≥6 mmHg) and without (HVPG \<6 mmHg) portal hypertension.

outcomeMeasures.title: Results of HepQuant SHUNT Test: Systemic Hepatic Filtration Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Compare Disease Severity Index (DSI) from HQ-SHUNT for defining patients with (HVPG ≥6 mmHg) and without (HVPG \<6 mmHg) portal hypertension.

outcomeMeasures.title: Results of HepQuant SHUNT Test: Portal Hepatic Filtration Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Compare Disease Severity Index (DSI) from HQ-SHUNT for defining patients with (HVPG ≥6 mmHg) and without (HVPG \<6 mmHg) portal hypertension.

outcomeMeasures.title: Results of HepQuant SHUNT Test: SHUNT
outcomeMeasures.description:
Compare Disease Severity Index (DSI) from HQ-SHUNT for defining patients with (HVPG ≥6 mmHg) and without (HVPG \<6 mmHg) portal hypertension.

SHUNT% is The percent of the oral dose of cholate that escapes hepatic extraction

outcomeMeasures.title: Results of HepQuant SHUNT Test: DSI Score
outcomeMeasures.description:
Compare Disease Severity Index (DSI) from HQ-SHUNT for defining patients with (HVPG ≥6 mmHg) and without (HVPG \<6 mmHg) portal hypertension.

DSI range is from 0 to 50. 0 implies no disease; 50 implies severe end-stage disease.

outcomeMeasures.title: Survey Patients on Their Experience of Having Both HQ-SHUNT and HVPG Procedures.
outcomeMeasures.description: Overall experience and willingness to repeat 0-10 Scale 0 being no pain, 10 being severe pain 0 being no discomfort, 10 being severe discomfort 0 being no interference with daily life, 10 being unable to carry on activities 0 being very negative experience, 10 being very positive experience 0 being definitely not wanting to have the test again, 10 being very willing to have the test again

outcomeMeasures.title: Hours for Test
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of hours it took for subjects to complete each test

outcomeMeasures.title: Results of HepQuant SHUNT Test: STAT
outcomeMeasures.description: Compare HepQuant STAT test from HQ-SHUNT for defining patients with (HVPG ≥6 mmHg) and without (HVPG \<6 mmHg) portal hypertension. HepQuant STAT is a simple "drink and draw" blood-based clearance test that quantifies hepatic impairment from early through late stages of disease.
